alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 3:50AM CST until January 09 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTRY WEATHER CONDITIONS IMPROVING WITH TIME TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Lingering light snow and blowing snow that has already fallen. Additional snow accumulations less than one-half inch, if any at all. North-northwest winds still gusting 30 to 40 MPH this morning, but very slowly decreasing with time. * WHERE...Sherman and Valley Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Although the vast majority of falling snow has ended, continued strong north-northwest winds this morning will result in continued blowing snow, which could still reduce visibility especially in open, rural areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind speeds will steadily decrease with time today, resulting in improving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
